title: Find the Source of the Gasping Spores
prologue1: Ruark wheezed, those parts of skin still exposed bearing some semblance to a molting hill goat. Bits of flesh hung loosely from his face and boils ran rampant across his body.
prologue2: The farmer from Loomwood whispered riddles before his throat fully closed up, 'The spores drifted into Loomwood yesterday, near the Pearlescent Marsh. The prophecy of Banuk's Brown Book has passed. The spirit of the swamp curses us!'
prologue3: An older woman steps forward from the band of settlers, her words colored by fear, 'We can't live like this! Too many lives lost! Where is this blight coming from?'
challenge1: The small yellow spores are difficult to see
challenge2: Pattern of infections within Loomwood seem related to lunar cycles
challenge3: Mana rifts flow from the marsh
epilogue1: Suddenly, the marsh rises up before you in a whirling mass of debris. A voice echoes through your thoughts, 'Do not disturb the marsh or we will consume you!' Will you stay in Loomwood or pull the farmers back to Giant's Gate?
epilogue2: Stay: xxBRIGHTDUNE Loomwood, xxOBSTACLE Ur-Akti, xxOBSTACLE Yellow Blight, xxSCENE Disperse Riots in Loomwood.
epilogue3: Abandon: xxBRIGHTDUNE Pearlescent Marsh, xxOBSTACLE Grain Shortage, xxSCENE Answer Scorpion-Tail's Riddle.

title: Retrieve the Owner of a Thousand Horses' Horses
prologue1: Kanun sighed before replying, 'Fuscus, these are no common ponies. These are great steeds, destriers of thunder, accompanied by the legendary charger Murjan. Put aside your petty jealousies of Hogel. So he threw an extravagant party and didn't invite you, so what? Who cares about wearing stuffy clothes, drinking rare wine, and dancing?'
prologue2: Fuscus stared back at Kanun in disbelief. 'Kanun, those are the only things to care about!'
prologue3: Kanun continued unimpeded, 'Recovering these horses would win favor with the Sunriders. How hard can it be to find a herd of horses?'
challenge1: The horses have splintered into small bands, roaming onto different grazing lands
challenge2: Bandits cover the horses tracks and fire arrows at trackers from high ridges
challenge3: Murjan stands proud over the other horses, running swift and unbroken
epilogue1: The Owner of a Thousand Horses closed the horse pen behind him. 'We thank you for recovering most of our horses! Murjan still roams free, but that horse was always more trouble than it was worth. Brightdune is always welcome at my manor! Even Fuscus.'
epilogue2: xxSETTLED Hogeltown, xxOBSTACLE Hogel's Jealousy, xxOBSTACLE Horse Bandits, xxASSET Hogel, xxASSET Murjan, xxSCENE Help Hogel Woo Pox Face.

title: Persuade the Satrap to Guard the North
prologue1: Parin sat back down on her poshti, resigned to hearing out the satrap's diatribe on defending the ports. Once he hit full stride, he was difficult to reason with.
prologue2: Where the satrap got this idea that the Empire would attack by sea, Parin had no idea. Certainly not from Zeno, Metrodora, or any of the rest of Brightdune's spies. Their suggestions were unanimous: prepare for an attack through Boar's Rift.
prologue3: It would require delicate maneuvering to get resources where they needed to be. Delir, commander of the Jasper Cataphract, glanced at Parin and rolled his eyes, 'Maybe stuffing him full of food would help?'
challenge1: The satrap is stubborn and fearful
challenge2: Morale amongst the War Council is low
challenge3: The satrap has his own desires and pet projects: to build a marble statuary on palace grounds
epilogue1: The satrap stood abruptly, walking away while shouting, 'Very well! Very well! Enough prattle! Waste your time in the north, and if they strike by sea, the deaths of the innocents will be on your heads.'
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Boar's Rift, xxASSET Delir, xxOBSTACLE Allocating Funds.

title: Take Second at the Amber Wine Drinking Game
prologue1: Kanun frowned. Winning this contest would be as easy as lassoing one of Horsemaster Babak's broken down mares.
prologue2: However! Parin wanted to lose to Rastag of the Amber Hand but somehow also defeat the Iron Cypress. That task sounded more challenging than lassoing the Dusk Hydra!
prologue3: And why such confusing political maneuvers? Why not just win outright?
prologue4: Still, Parin had a sense about these things. And she was certain raising up Rastag would secure aid from the surrounding Amber Hand farms.
challenge1: The Iron Cypress is known to do whatever it takes to win, regardless of the rules and regardless of the consequences
challenge2: Amber Wine causes pronounced drowsiness in the imbiber
challenge3: Rastag weighs 93 pounds
epilogue1: Iron Cypress looked around in disbelief, unable to comprehend the events that just transpired. Rastag raised his hands, then collapsed to the ground, vomiting terribly.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Giant's Gate, xxASSET Amber Wine.

title: Decipher Gelshah's Scroll
prologue1: '...and he buried them in the earth! But why would he do such a thing?' Kanun asked.
prologue2: 'Have you not been listening?' Yasmina said. 'In the end, Gelshah's pride bound him to the daeva. And together they desecrated the corpses, corrupting the earth and placing a death curse on his tower.'
prologue3: 'So this scroll will allow us to access the tower somehow? What language is this?'
prologue4: 'These marking indicate a polylinguistic cypher, referencing a series of important historical writing that can be synthesized to solve it!' Yasmina said, working herself up into a frenzy. 'Let's get started!'
prologue5: 'And is it a problem if I can't read?'
prologue6: 'Uh, yes. Yes, that will make things trickier.'
challenge1: The most ancient tomes are locked with runes of Forbidden Nightmares
challenge2: Others texts are nothing more than fragments, having been eroded or written over for future uses
challenge3: The texts are written in ancient languages, some of them no longer spoken
epilogue1: The scroll shutters and comes to life, unlocking the wards which have sealed Gelshah's Tower for centuries. The tower is unlocked from without... and within, releasing whatever had been buried there.
epilogue2: xxBRIGHTDUNE Gelshah's Tower, xxOBSTACLE Restless Dead, xxOBSTACLE Restless Dead, xxSCENE Steal Gelshah's Heart, xxASSET Yasmina.

title: Find the Mad Honey Supplier
prologue1: 'Parin, I have no idea what you're talking about. Besides, I've heard the negative effects of Mad Honey use are overstated,' Fuscus said with a smirk.
prologue2: 'Overstated! Have you met Farmer Snog Butt lately? He speaks only in riddles! He sounds like scorpion-tail! We need to figure out where this stuff is coming from,' Parin replied.
prologue3: 'Yes, okay, fine,' Fuscus said with a sigh. 'Let me ask around. Then we need to find someone up to the task of finding the supplier.'
prologue4: 'Couldn't you do that?' Parin queried.
prologue5: 'I mean... could I? Yes, I could. But would I? It sounds tedious. What's Keel up to?'
challenge1: The Mad Honey seems to originate from a remote trading hall called The Obfuscated Bribe
challenge2: Entering the hall requires a referral from a member
challenge3: It is rumored that Farokh the weaver is a member in good standing, but he lives a comfortable life and is difficult to bribe
epilogue1: The Mad Honey is being dealt out of the Obfuscated Bribe by The Sparkling Plum, an enigmatic figure who no one seems willing to identify.
epilogue2: xxBRIGHTDUNE Obfuscated Bribe, xxASSET Mad Honey, xxOBSTACLE Mad Honey Addiction, xxSCENE Cut Off the Mad Honey Supply.

title: Feed the Lyric Stone to the Dusk Hydra
prologue1: 'If we feed it this old rock with the faces on it, the flooding in the Golden Hills will stop? Weird. Also, what kind of hydra only has two heads?' Fuscus asked.
prologue2: Yasmina attempted to respond, 'It's not a rock, and it doesn't have two heads, it's...'
prologue3: 'Well, it looks like a rock!' Fuscus said. 'Bolat is going to owe us for this one. You know, I don't think I've ever talked to a hydra. There was this lavender dragon once. But they're annoying. No class at all. And this hydra, what, just makes you feel bad about yourself? Fat chance of that. I'm amazing.'
prologue4: '...two dragons.' Yasmina said to no one in particular.
challenge1: One head is ferocious and golden yellow, the other ghostly white
challenge2: The golden mouth speaks scathing words
challenge3: The ghostly mouth is cold and calculating
challenge4: One must be soothed while the stone is secretly fed to the other
epilogue1: The Dusk Hydra trembles and splits apart! Which dragon did you give the stone to?
epilogue2: Ghostly: xxSETTLED Golden Hills, xxASSET Dragon of the Frozen Voice, xxOBSTACLE Dragon of the Critical Word, xxSCENE Broker Peace Between the Three Houses.
epilogue3: Golden: xxSETTLED Golden Hills, xxASSET Dragon of the Critical Word, xxOBSTACLE Dragon of the Frozen Voice, xxSCENE Melt the Hydra's Frozen Tongues.

title: Intercept Freetrader Plans
prologue1: In the fading sunlight, Keel watched a quickly moving figure cross the alley below him, heading towards a door opposite Keel's vantage point. Keel aimed a crossbow bolt at the roof across from him, squeezed his hand, and shot. The bolt clicked open into a grappling hook as soon as it left the crossbow. It flew across the gap, wire trailing behind it, before it caught on the roof.
prologue2: Keel tugged on the reeling mechanism and jumped. The wire pulled him up so he could grab onto the edge and haul himself over, rolling silently out of the jump. Keel collected himself just in time to hear the figure say 'A drought of red for the left eye' before being let into the back alley door.
challenge1: The Imperial Freetrader hideout is guarded by a large bouncer at the back door
challenge2: There are windows around the structure, but they are barred from the inside
challenge3: Their plans are kept in a locked chest on the second floor
epilogue1: Much of the recovered plans are in code, but it's clear that Whitehold is central to the Empire's plans. A spy from Whitehold, Aldric, is tasked with spreading discord throughout Brightdune.
epilogue2: xxEMPIRE Whitehold, xxOBSTACLE Aldric the Deceitful, xxOBSTACLE Background Checks, xxASSET Imperial Codebook, xxSCENE Escape from Whitehold Prison.

title: Ambush Military Scouts
prologue1: The winter storm whipped through the pass, blasting tiny crystals of ice into Kanun's face. He rode hard into the easterly wind, gripping the reins tightly. 'Come on girl, nothing we haven't been through before. Parin is counting on us.'
prologue2: The news from Eastkeep was unsettling, even for a veteran like Kanun. The wars in the West were ending, and Imperial forces were quickly building up again along the front. The Settled Land's forces were young, and worse yet, inexperienced. Imperial scouts had been sighted in the area. Setting up an ambush could yield valuable intelligence for the war effort.
challenge1: Imperial scouts move quickly in groups of three, fanning out to avoid surprise
challenge2: One scout in each group holds a warhorn, which they are trained to sound at the first sign of trouble
epilogue1: Although a thorough job of interrogating the scouts was impossible, the scouts did divulge future means of attack against fortresses in the East. War Machines capable of launching flaming shot were being developed, and disgruntled Amber Hand settlers were paid to lower defenses. Following these revelations, defenses would need to be stepped up quickly. Time was running short.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Boar's Peak, xxOBSTACLE Amber Hand Raiders.

title: Disperse Riots in Loomwood
prologue1: 'When I feel like that, I ride my horse as fast as I can across the plains. Have you tried that?' Kanun asked.
prologue2: Parin sighed quietly and looked towards the setting sun. 'I have not.'
prologue3: Parin was certain the situation in Loomwood required a delicate touch. The blight had torn through their villages, creating fear and distrust, making it easier for the Autarch's voice to find a willing ear. Vidarna was threatening to separate from Brightdune, lashing out at well-meaning patrols and aid. The worst approach was to meet his distrust with violence.
prologue4: 'As for Loomwood, they will submit if we make a strong show of force,' Kanun said.
challenge1: The people of Loomwood are descendants of the Amber Hand
challenge2: Virdana, Speaker for Loomwood, leads attacks on Brightdune border patrols
challenge3: The old songs haven't been sung since the swamp attacked
challenge4: Talks are colored with fear, fear of the horrors unleashed by the swamp
epilogue1: It doesn't happen overnight, but the people of Loomwood feel heard. Their distrust is high, but the attacks have stopped, and trade slowly resumes.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Loomwood, xxASSET Songs of Loomwood, xxOBSTACLE The Forgotten Dead.

title: Answer Scorpion-Tail's Riddle
prologue1: 'Why would I do that?' Scorpion-Tail exclaimed, feigning indignation. 'It's not in my nature.'
prologue2: The flowers and dense foliage of the Marsh cast dappled light on the ground. Parin knelt in front of the large beast, her head low, although the sharp claws of Scorpion-Tail sank into the soft ground a mere foot in front of her.
prologue3: 'Why is the Autarch doing this? What's the point? What's her goal?' Parin asked again.
prologue4: 'Oh Beauteous Visitor, surely you have brought me more than questions?'
prologue5: Parin frowned. What an irritating thing. Where was Yasmina when you needed her?
challenge1: Scorpion-Tail knows the answers to many questions, but he is prideful and smug, speaking only in riddles
challenge2: He seeks vulnerability and compassion for none have shown him any
challenge3: Scorpion-Tail wants presents, but only as surprises, and he is picky
epilogue1: Scorpion-Tail continued, 'The Autarch was Eighth Born from a Bear Trainer and a Court Dancer. Then the Autarch was taken, the youngest ever to undertake The Harrowing. The Autarch has two-sides, like the warp and weft. Like order and chaos.'
epilogue2: 'I, on the other hand, have but one side.'
epilogue3: xxDEVELOPED Develop Pearlescent Marsh, xxASSET Pearlescent Lotus, xxASSET Mask of the Frenzied Beast.

title: Help Hogel Woo Pox Face
prologue1: Fuscus smiled broadly. 'I'm here for you old friend, I just need you to say it.'
prologue2: 'Fuscus - help me win over Pox Face!' Hogel said, cheeks burning red.
prologue3: 'Okay pal! I'll do what I can, but I'm no miracle worker. It's up to her. I'm also surprised, I didn't think you were the marrying kind, if you understand me,' Fuscus winked.
prologue4: 'My parents,' Hogel said. 'They say it's time, and I have to attract someone who is worthy of their respect.'
prologue5: 'And Pox Face it is! Well, we just have to get you some new outfits, give you a stylish beard trim, and change your entire personality. After that, well, stranger things have happened.'
challenge1: Pox Face is not overly fond of horses
challenge2: She is surrounded by jealous suitors, each trained in a different style of poetry
challenge3: She is wise and well-read and apt to see through secret plans or tricks
challenge4: Pox Face secretly desires a man who can play the drums in the polyrhythmic style of the Golden Hills Folk
epilogue1: 'Well, my parents have been telling me it is time,' Pox Face said. 'And you're much different than the well-spoken handsome men who ask for my hand. I can easily tell when you lie. So you may call upon me on the next feast day. Bring honey cakes.'
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Hogeltown, xxASSET Pox Face, xxOBSTACLE Rage of the Forlorn Suitors.

title: Steal Gelshah's Heart
prologue1: Yasmina looked out over the ominous landscape before turning back to Keel and Fuscus. 'We can't consecrate the tower until Gelshah's Heart is removed from its center.'
prologue2: Keel fiddled idly with his lariat before responding, 'You think I'm capable of avoiding the traps of unmaking and somehow coming out alive this gem?'
prologue3: 'If anyone has a hope of doing something like this, it's you!' Yasmina said.
prologue4: Keel flushed briefly and looked away.
prologue5: 'Uh, sure, yeah,' Fuscus said, a tremore of fear gracing his voice. 'We believe in you buddy.' Fuscus stared up at the tower, very glad that so far no one thought to include him in this suicide run.
challenge1: An intense cold lingers around the outside of the tower, making it difficult to think or move
challenge2: Staircases within the tower shift and flip to create a labyrinth capable of trapping even the most careful visitors
challenge3: A dark shroud coats the inside of the tower, resisting the glow of torches or fires
epilogue1: Removing the stone releases the curse blighting the tower, beginning the long process of returning the dead to its top.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Gelshah's Tower, xxASSET Gelshah's Heart.

title: Cut Off the Mad Honey Supply
prologue1: 'It's not only The Obfuscated Bribe,' Parin muttered, poring over the list of merchants in Brightdune. 'Where else could they sell this Mad Honey from?'
prologue2: 'I heard the Amber Winery is dealing in it,' Fuscus said. 'Making filthy money, too.'
prologue3: 'Really? How do you know?'
prologue4: 'I'm always on the lookout for criminal scum. Like the Amber Winery. Oh! Yes, and Naudur's Goods.'
prologue5: 'Since when are you so concerned with crime?' Kanun interjected.
prologue6: Fuscus spared him a withering glance before he added, 'Farnaka's Sundries, too, of course. Let's shut them all down.'
challenge1: The Amber Winery has many clientele that come in at all hours, day and night, making it difficult to access any hidden documents without being spotted
challenge2: Naudur is a paranoid man; there are rumors his office is trapped to those who dare try to steal
challenge3: Farnaka's outdoor stall makes it easy for everyone in town to see anyone approach
epilogue1: Many Mad Honey dealers have thankfully been eliminated, leaving the Obfuscated Bribe's Sparkling Plum as the only dealer at large. The Obfuscated Bribe spreads their network to bring more information back to Brightdune.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop The Obfuscated Bribe, xxASSET Pin of the Plum, xxOBSTACLE Distrustful Merchants.

title: Broker Peace Between the Three Houses
prologue1: Pox Face whispered something into Parin's ear. Parin blushed and her eyes went wide, scanning the gathered audience quickly.
prologue2: 'Really! Is this not serious to you?' Rastag said, glaring at them. His words echoed across the domed hall.
prologue3: 'Like you should talk Rastag - all of a sudden you're the speaker for the Amber Hand?', Virdana said. 'Chief? Hah! Chief Gossiper of the Golden Hills!'
prologue4: Pox Face raised her eyebrows at Parin and giggled loudly.
prologue5: Parin couldn't understand what was going on. Usually this group got along, maybe not well, but well enough. Why such vitriol?
challenge1: Anger is rippling through Brightdune and the Settled Lands
challenge2: The Dragon of the Critical Word is influencing proceedings, pouring hate into the allies' voices
challenge3: Pox Face acts juvenile while Rastag and Virdana poke at old hurts
epilogue1: Although words can't be unsaid, tempers have calmed enough to worry about more pressing matters. Develop Golden Hills.

title: Melt the Hydra's Frozen Tongues
prologue1: 'The weather is nice today,' Pox-Face said as she walked alongside Parin.
prologue2: 'Yes,' Parin said, watching her close friend curiously. They never talked about such trivial things. 'Now, back to our future meeting...'
prologue3: 'Maybe we should have it outside,' Pox-Face mused. 'The breeze is pleasant.'
prologue4: Parin stopped, glaring at Pox Face. 'Can you not speak of anything important?' Parin demanded. 'We are in trying times, and such frivolity...'
prologue5: Pox Face's strained expression told Parin all she needed to know.
challenge1: The Fireshrine holding the cure to frozen tongues is guarded by the dragon of the frozen voice
challenge2: The dragon casts utter silence around its home; so much as a snapping twig will get you caught
challenge3: Its sharp eyes can spot a gnat from fifty leagues away
epilogue1: The Fireshrine's blessing thaws the frozen tongues of Golden Hills, bringing a new realm of peace. Develop Golden Hills.

title: Escape from Whitehold Prison
prologue1: 'Anyone dumb enough to stand up for themselves winds up here. Well, unless they were thrown off the wall,' Lucia said, guiding Keel through the halls of Whitehold, the stolen guard's armor heavy on their limber frames. 'More than enough people here to assist in your futile attempts at rebellion.'
prologue2: 'Your confidence in us is inspiring,' Keel said. 'How do you know your way through here so well?'
prologue3: 'It's not my first time breaking out.'
prologue4: 'Yourself... or... others?' Keel said, but Lucia kept walking. Right.
prologue5: 'Quiet now. Keep your head down, and follow my lead,' Lucia said.
challenge1: There are several guards patrolling that must be avoided
challenge2: Many more may be captured; an efficient and reliable escape route is necessary
challenge3: Some of those who are captured believe the war is already lost and escape or rebellion makes little difference
epilogue1: An ally against the Empire is released from the prison. He helps you uncover secret networks of passages within Whitehold.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Whitehold, xxASSET Zeno the Squidmonger, xxOBSTACLE Guard Captain.

title: Brighten Brightdune Spirits
prologue1: 'We can't reduce the enemy to a faceless horde. We can't lose our humanity. Imperials are victims just as we are, and our struggles are not so black and white.'
prologue2: 'Fuscus, I know!' Parin said angrily. 'But what would you have us do? Give up? Flee? To where?'
prologue3: 'Considering the nuances of the Empire's plight will not give us armor from their arrows,' Parin continued. 'Empathizing with their suffering will not blunt their swords. We must rally behind Brightdune. Thank you for your perspective, Fuscus, but now is not the time.'
prologue4: Fuscus smiled, nodded, and walked away.
challenge1: The Amber Hand feels they are bearing an undue burden from the war
challenge2: The Empire's resources seem limitless compared to Brightdune's
challenge3: Frustration is growing towards the wounded soldiers now reduced to begging
epilogue1: Parin held the soldier's hand as he battled the fever another night. 'I think he's past the worst of it now. Another night, maybe two,' Parin said, smiling weakly toward the young man's mother.
epilogue2: The woman looked back calmly, before responding, 'Respectfully, it will be many nights before we're past the worst of it.'

title: Infiltrate Guild of War
prologue1: Eastkeep, well positioned within a narrow gorge, is further defended by massive stone walls. Fourteen towers are positioned along the walls, dedicated to repelling attacks from without. Centermost along the wall is the Spring Gate, ornamented with marble and gold leaf.
prologue2: Though the central traffic flowed through the gate, rumors hinted at ancient passages built during the reign of The Farlight.
prologue3: Furthermore, The Guild of War, one of the tactical resources heavily utilized by the Empire, may be breached. Access to the Guild would allow for military plans to be taken from The Empire.
challenge1: Guards patrol the passageways at erratic intervals
challenge2: Tunnels are difficult to climb, and disgusting sewage flows through them
challenge3: Entrance to Guild is through a hatch high in a cistern ceiling
epilogue1: The hatch opens, revealing a chamber deep within The Guild of War. Blueprints and plans cover the walls and tables of this small room.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Eastkeep, xxASSET Mirror of Melting.

title: Strengthen Bonds at the Gala of the Brass Apple
prologue1: Zarrah held out her hand to Parin of Brightdune, bowing courteously. Of course, Zarrah didn't trust Parin, or anyone from Brightdune for that matter. But this was a time to watch and listen.
prologue2: Zarrah looked around at the impressive array of guests, from Gravewood, Crescent Hold, Sevan Vale, Brightdune, the Sunriders, and... The Empire. The Subtect was bold enough to show his face.
prologue3: 'We have much to catch up on,' Parin said.
prologue4: Zarrah nodded again. This would be difficult to navigate. She had sympathy for Brightdune, but the whispers from her spies were troubling. What was the truth? What was Brightdune up to?
challenge1: The Subtect spreads fear and paranoia among Brightdune's allies
challenge2: Thea of Crescent Hold favors research into technology and military might
challenge3: Samo of Gravewood trades in secrets and leans toward an isolated existence in the north
epilogue1: Zarrah smiled as she left the feast hall. While still awkward and too transparent, the diplomats from Brightdune had made a good impression. She looked forward to their visits.
epilogue2: xxSETTLED Lily Manor, xxSCENE Barter Luxuries for Zarrah's Favor, xxOBSTACLE The Subtect.

title: Barter Luxuries for Zarrah's Favor
prologue1: 'Zarrah, my darling! It is wonderful to see you again,' Fuscus said, a broad smile on his face and his hands spread wide. 'It has been far too long. But, well, current events may have interfered.'
prologue2: 'Hello again, Fuscus,' Zarrah said, her own lips curling into a smile. 'I can imagine, sharing a border with the Empire. As much as I'd like this to be a mere visit, is it safe to assume you have come to ask more from me? I am certain Brightdune needs all the support it can get.'
prologue3: Fuscus bowed. 'I am afraid so. But I can, of course, sweeten the deal for you. I am never one to ask for something I cannot return. Goods, secrets, you know my abilities, and what I can do for you,' he said, winking.
challenge1: Zarrah is a firm believer in give and take
challenge2: Lily Manor has far more luxuries than Brightdune
challenge3: Zarrah dislikes the taste of Amber wine
epilogue1: Zarrah is willing to trade valuable resources with Brightdune, securing a prosperous relationship between Brightdune and Lily Manor.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Lily Manor, xxASSET Zarrah, xxOBSTACLE Zarrah's Paranoia.

title: Drive Corruption's Heart from the Blighted Lands
prologue1: 'The Autarch is channeling the spirit from Yearly Field, corrupting the land. Soon this corruption will infect everything; plants, animals, maybe even people,' Parin said.
prologue2: Kanun grumbled, cleaning his sword instead of looking at Parin. Witchcraft was so annoying! A sword should kill everything.
prologue3: 'We found a weakness, though,' Parin said. 'There's a heart. A twisted beating knot of tangled root and fur, both living and unliving. If that is destroyed, it should eliminate the corruption.'
prologue4: Kanun paused. 'Destroy it,' he said. 'Like... with a sword?'
prologue5: Parin smirked, 'Yes, Kanun, with a sword.'
challenge1: The blighted animals have gone feral and attack anyone uninfected
challenge2: Corrupted plants sprout up everywhere, wrapping around the unprepared
challenge3: Corruption's Heart can move underground, making it hard to find and destroy
epilogue1: With the removal of Corruption's Heart, life begins to bloom again in Yearly Field.
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Yearly Field, xxOBSTACLE Corruptions Heart.

title: Create a Pact with the Weaver
prologue1: High in the mossy gloom of the forest canopy, several glowing eyes carefully watched the clearing below. From within, a scratchy voice said, 'I'm ready for your apology, but I won't forgive you for burning my loom.'
prologue2: Suddenly, a dark robed form arose from the dust in the clearing. 'I know,' the form said. 'I'm sorry. I held so much fear.'
prologue3: The robed figure continued, 'May we seek an audience? May we receive your council? May we see what your eyes may see?'
prologue4: Delicate spindly legs pushed branches aside, revealing the Weaver's striped face. 'You can never see what I see! But you know that, don't you? And your adopted people may speak to me, and you will listen also.'
challenge1: The Weaver can see the Autarch's fates, but requires a sacrifice to reveal them
challenge2: The Weaver remembers the Dawncaves, and is impressed by knowledge of the first tribes
challenge3: The Weaver's lair is home to poisonous vines and mushrooms, clouding thought and action
epilogue1: 'It was nice to finally hear your pretty words and promises,' the Weaver said. 'And I will remember them.'
epilogue2: xxASSET The Uncut String, xxOBSTACLE The Weaver.

title: Establish Spy Network
prologue1: Metrodora re-tied her apron yet again, suddenly feeling uncomfortable in her clothes. The Rosy Freetrader was quiet and empty this morning before her guests showed up: an Apprentice in the Guild of Secrets and a young man dressed in the white robes of Harrowing. 'Did you mention to your friend that the Acolytes of Harrowing are older? And, well, not men?'
prologue2: 'I did mention that fact. Repeatedly,' the Apprentice said, fixing her glare towards the awkward looking man in the corner. The Apprentice turned back to Metrodora. 'Are Petros or Adriani able to meet?'
prologue3: Metrodora nodded. 'Yes. We can use the card room, but this place will be bustling later, so use more discretion. And listen properly this time, Keel!'
challenge1: The Rosy Freetrader makes a good base of operations; however, it is a popular watering hole for Imperial guards
challenge2: The leaders of the Resistance within the Empire are desperate for supplies and aid
challenge3: The Older Hoof, a boisterous regular, has become suspicious about who comes and goes from the back card room
epilogue1: We have agents in important positions, but our efforts are facing increased scrutiny,' Petros said, growing more exasperated. 'We appreciate your enthusiasm, but please coordinate with us better in the future.'
epilogue2: xxEMPIRE Rosy Freetrader, xxOBSTACLE Nosy Locals, xxSCENE Befriend the Master of Coin.

title: Befriend the Master of Coin
prologue1: 'And if that fails, we'll remove his manhood,' Lucia said calmly, running her finger along the edge of her dagger.
prologue2: 'I don't think- That is, there's no need...' Fuscus tried to reply, at a rare loss for words. 'What I mean to say is, flies like lavender syrup. Or honey, I mean. Could you maybe sheath your dagger while we talk?'
prologue3: 'No. It calms me.'
prologue4: 'Right,' Fuscus said. 'Look, no one climbs the ranks within the Guild of Coin unless they like money. Which means they can be bribed. And at the very least, you must agree that having the Master of Coin benefit from ignoring our questionable finances is better than having him swear vengeance in a pool of his own blood?'
challenge1: The Master of Coin is well paid by the Autarch to look into accounting irregularities amongst Whitehold merchants
challenge2: He lives in the Holy Gardens, where citizens dress in finery and speak the proper tongue of the landed class
challenge3: He enjoys games of logic and skill, like Six Dice and the partners variant of Wall Fall
epilogue1: The Master of Coin smiled broadly, arranging the dice for a split-six points doubler. 'Hah! I win again. I almost feel bad for how good I am. Another game?'
epilogue2: xxDEVELOPED Develop Rosy Freetrader. xxASSET Master of Coin.

title: Host the Tulip Festival
prologue1: 'This is no time to throw a party,' Kanun said. 'Wasting time with these frivolities when there are serious matters to attend to.'
prologue2: Fuscus looked up from tuning the harp and smiled. 'And are we to only fight wars, old friend? These things we do, these battles we fight, these fields we harvest, what is it for?'
prologue3: Fuscus pointed at the scattered groups beginning to gather in the morning sun. The children of the Amber Hand and the Five-Fold mingled and played together, waiting for the festivities to begin. Some children snuck away with bits of freshly baked bread, apples, and pomegranates. Pox Face's giggling laughter carried down into the valley from further away.
prologue4: 'This,' Fuscus said, his smile widening.
challenge1: Rastag dominates the music playing, not giving others a chance to lead, and joining in unasked with his discordant setar stylings
challenge2: Virdana only brought a small offering of stuffed Loomwood apples, the scarcity of which could cause fights and arguments
challenge3: Pox Face wishes to tell the Story of the Weave, but tradition dictates someone from Golden Hills should tell the tale
epilogue1: What is the weather like during the festival? Who sings the most inspiring song? Who bakes the best dessert? If the Empire invades, will these traditions survive?
epilogue2: Each player in this scene may take an xxASSET from staging area and place in their crafting area.

title: Assassinate Guild Leaders
prologue1: 'I assure you, they are complicit. And now is the time to remove them from power forever.'
prologue2: 'This is savagery,' Parin said. 'There are other, more effective means.'
prologue3: Lucia glared at Parin. 'Savagery? I can tell you stories of savagery. This is a kindness.'
prologue4: Petros stared intently at the map laid out on the table. 'I agree with Lucia. Unless we want the entire rebellion thrown off the wall, we must disrupt their leadership. We can exploit their distrust. Their plans and secrets will die with the guild leaders.'
prologue5: Petros pointed at the markings in the center of the map. 'We have a sudden opportunity. Many of them are currently here,' Petros said. 'We must strike now.'
challenge1: Petros demands to be involved in the operation, but he is a suspected of treason and watched closely by the Guild of Secrets
challenge2: Guild leaders send and receive messages in code, making it difficult to pinpoint their precise locations
challenge3: Each guild has its own insular language and command structure
epilogue1: How does the populace respond to the assassinations? What legacy does this leave for Brightdune?
epilogue2: Add xxPROGRESS xxPROGRESS to every xxOBSTACLE in the Empire. If the total tokens are higher than the obstacle's difficulty, may discard it. Place a xxTHREAT token from track on any xxEMPIRE location.

title: Voyage into the Autarch's Mind
prologue1: Iridescent boteh swirled through Parin's vision, making it difficult to discern reality. If such a concept even made sense here. The visions coalesced into promises broken and loved ones she failed to save. All of her failings were being reflected back. It was all too much. Too overwhelming.
prologue2: 'This is amazing, isn't it!' Yasmina said excitedly. 'I told you it would work! The Autarch can't absorb this much energy without opening herself up. Can you feel it? What she feels? Can you taste what she tastes? We can see her plans, and perhaps place our thoughts inside her mind. Gelshah's Tome of Channeling also mentioned feelings of guilt and shame become amplified, so stay positive!'
challenge1: The rift in the weave shows each character their shadow self, with distorted memories of guilt and shame
challenge2: Walk through the Arch of Burning Copper as the Autarch did in the Rite of Harrowing
challenge3: The Autarch's memories become confused with your own, leaving your identity vulnerable
epilogue1: Do any the Autarch's memories become embedded in your character's mind? Do any of your character's memories manifest in the Autarch's mind?
epilogue2: Roll and place 4 xxMAGIC dice at this location. Take stress as normal for xxMAGIC dice.

title: Burgle the Icon of Channeling
prologue1: Keel raised his bow, sighting the executioner towering behind Adriani, his large frame casting a shadow over her. The shot from this distance would be tricky, but not impossible. As he pulled back the string, a gloved hand suddenly grasped his arm, pushing him down against rooftop perch.
prologue2: 'Hold your shot! You'll ruin everything!' Lucia said under her breath. 'She knew the risks getting the location of the Icon to us.'
prologue3: Keel watched helplessly as Adriani plunged off the wall, falling to the ground below, mercifully out of this sight.
prologue4: 'We have people in position and we need you alive. Honor her sacrifice by helping us steal their precious weapon.'
challenge1: There is a wide yard between the outer and inner vault walls, which is watched by guards posted along the inner wall
challenge2: The entrance hall inside the vault has whirling blade traps offset a specific number of steps. Novices of Harrowing are trained to walk the hall blindfolded
challenge3: The Icon is kept in the Chest of Fifteen Eyes. Each eye is bound to a Master of Harrowing
epilogue1: What happens to the Imperial Resistance when the Icon is stolen? Does the Guild of Secrets execute any other sympathizers?
epilogue2: Place xxASSET Icon of Channeling in asset staging area. Icon ignores staging area card limits.

title: Call Allies to Arms
prologue1: 'I yield to Elisa's wisdom,' Yasmina said quietly. 'It's too risky to meddle in the weave. We don't understand the consequences.'
prologue2: 'Too risky? Too risky! Yes, we don't know everything, but we do know what will happen when the Autarch arrives,' Parin responded, scanning the faces in the crowded meeting hall. She was trying to stay calm, but the time for plans was over. 'What say you Pox Face? Or you Samo? Zarrah?'
prologue3: Pox Face stood in response to being called on directly. 'Parin, I have known you since we ran barefoot through the Golden HIlls. You know I support you, but we all have concerns. Are you sure you know what we're getting into? We have the wellbeing of our own people to consider.'
challenge1: The conflict with the Empire has become drawn out, fraying nerves
challenge2: Elisa and Yasmina, of Sevan Vale, are concerned Brightdune isn't taking the dangers of using sorcery seriously enough
challenge3: Pox Face and The Sunriders are worried their horse supply can't sustain the war effort much longer
challenge4: Zarrah of Lily Manor is cautiously hedging against a Brightdune loss
epilogue1: Which ally has supported Brightdune the most during the war with the Empire? Why? Which ally has supported Brightdune the least? Why?
epilogue2: Each player in this scene draws the two xxABILITY cards.

title: Slay the Hundred-Handed Idolater
prologue1: From high on the wall, Kanun watched the frenzied mob spread out behind the marble titan. The goat-headed colossus smashed into the fortification wall with its massive fists, opening up a hole for its fifty followers to flow into.
prologue2: The fanatics, of all ages and abilities, ran through the opening into the courtyard. A young woman threw some kind of gray dust at the guards nearest her, prompting them to scream in agony as some impossible decay gripped them.
prologue3: 'Fire!' Kanun shouted from above.
prologue4: Scattered archers on the wall and in the courtyard frantically loosed their arrows. Kanun wasn't sure it would be enough.
challenge1: The Idolator's Followers have little humanity left, attacking furiously and with an inhuman strength
challenge2: The Idolator is a massive construct made of marble and bronze, capable of destroying an entire unit with one blow
challenge3: The Followers have dust from the shadow realm, capable of creating restless dead from those who fall in battle
epilogue1: When the giant is felled, what happens to the followers? Are they still beholden to the Idolator? What does each character wish to do with the casualties of war?
epilogue2: Each player in this scene gains two xxINITIATIVE dice.

title: Impress the Keeper of Forbidden Lore
prologue1: The thawing of Boar's Pass brought Elisa, hierophant of the Blue Robes, to Brightdune. Ringed by her retinue of blue clad wizards, she addressed her audience.
prologue2: 'I received Thea's message. Burgan Vale can provide aid - yet we have concerns. Can we trust you with our secrets from the Tower of Arankh? Will you respect the Veil of Magic?'
challenge1: How do you gain Elisa's trust?
challenge2: Elisa is a potion crafter and channeler from Burgan Vale
challenge3: The people of Burgan Vale tend to be reserved in speech and manner
epilogue1: 'Very well - you have our aid. Travel to Arankh, where Yasmina is waiting for you. She is one of our brightest adepts and has been researching the nature of the Autarch's magic.'

title: Inscribe the Ritual of Cleaving
prologue1: Yasmina smiled. 'Hi! I've been expecting you. Oh yes, for sure, you've got big problems. Do you understand the seven aetheric side-effects of transplanar channeling? No? Wow.'
prologue2: 'Okay, then, well, somewhere in these 6,006 tomes are references to curses utilizing eddies in the mana flow. If we can correlate each approach to this curse, we can surely formulate a defense. Let's get to work!'
challenge1: How do you create the ritual?
challenge2: The most ancient books are locked with runes of mind blasting
challenge3: Other books in the sprawling library are written in forgotten tongues
epilogue1: 'Yes! We've done it! Well done! But these references to an ancient tome in Gelshah's Tower are prescient. If you can get past the ancient sanity-blasting traps, it would be worthwhile to recover.'

title: Recover Thedda's Palimpsest
prologue1: The perfectly sane wizard Gelshah left all manner of traps and tricks for anyone foolhardy enough to wander his tower. Particularly well-guarded is his prized possession, Thedda's Palimpsest.
prologue2: Written in silver blood drained from the archdruid herself, the palimpsest is protected by illusions of thirst, copper worms, and frost magic.
challenge1: How do you survive Gelshah's Tower?
challenge2: Frost mephits cast teeth-freeze runes as you ascend the tower
challenge3: The Palimpsest is hidden amongst other nondescript books, and warded by lightning
epilogue1: With the Palimpsest in hand, the work can begin to unravel the Autarch's curse. Questions remain - where is the Autarch drawing strength from, and how can she be stopped?

title: Scouting Yearly Field
prologue1: Menas gently stroked Drift's white mane, looking out along the plains from his vantage point near Automaton Rock. How easy could it be to find an army? And yet the massive sweep of ruins and basalt flows made travel difficult.
prologue2: 'May the Hawk of the East guide us this day.' Menas shined his speaking mirror toward the other party across the valley. Food and weather were becoming concerns. But there was nothing to do but continue on.
challenge1: Where is the Empire hiding and how do you find them?
challenge2: The terrain is hostile, dotted with pits and caverns
challenge3: The Empire's units are dispersed, moving quickly among the basalt columns
epilogue1: The situation was more dire than expected. A force many hundreds strong was moving much closer to Brightdune than expected.

title: Defend Boar's Rift
prologue1: Thea looked out from the battered and beaten fortress wall running along Boar's Rift. The thin morning sun reflected off the spears, pikes, and crimson flags in the fields beyond. The Empire's forces were well-disciplined. They would not break easily, and it wasn't clear how long the main wall would hold.
prologue2: Thea considered her options. Continuing to press the attack was crucial, but further losses were unsustainable. At some hour they must engage in a controlled withdrawal. Would that day come today?
challenge1: What tactics are used to defend Boar's Rift?
challenge2: Boar's Rift is an ancient fortress ringed with archer towers
challenge3: Beyond the fortress is a low, wide, canyon ringed by dense fir trees
epilogue1: Thea wrapped a young archer's wounds before addressing Brightdune's weary soldiers. 'You fought well today, with both courage and wit. Hold strong for Brightdune.'

title: Secrets of Whitehold
prologue1: Whitehold's trading markets were reserved and understated, merchants and patrolling guards looking at each other with suspicious eyes. A robed figure moved carefully down the cobblestone street, looking for a good out of the way site from which to conduct operations.
prologue2: The figure waited a moment next to a nondescript door before applying a unique knock, three quick knocks followed by two slow ones.
prologue3: The door opened slowly, allowing the person inside. 'Well met - you have your work cut out for you, let's get started.'
challenge1: How do you gain access to the Empire's plans?
challenge2: The war machines are developed by the Guild of Strategy
challenge3: The plans are kept behind steel vaults with five rotating locks
epilogue1: Keel referenced the diagram one last time before placing a large lens at the end of a strange alien device. 'Redirecting the sun! Well done Keel,' Keel said to an empty hall.
